page.title: 16Thame Schools and Churches
page.content: For Lord Williams see pages 4 and 15. {Thame Primary Schools} Thame boasts three Primary schools, the oldest built in 1836 is John Hampden with over 400 pupils. Barley Hill, built in the 70's caters for the post- war housing estates, with over 300 pupils. Most recently, St.Joseph's a small R.C. School was opened ten years ago next to the Catholic Church. It has about 130 children. {Thame Churches} There are 4 active church communities in Thame. St. Mary's Anglican have a fine 12th cent. church. St. Joseph's RC have been here since 1913. The Baptists and United church also have strong congregations. There is a strong ecumenical movement with many joint meetings and services run by the local Council of Churches.
